column5: What a sweet deal it was. Cabelas open 9 am. I B-Line to the bargian cave. Loads of tying materials marked down stupid crazy prices. 50-75 % savings. Loaded up. Then I see this wrapped up thing with just some brass showing. Pick it up,read the tag and say,no way. There is usually a note saying something is missing. I ask the lady if she could cut the tape and wrap so I could look at it. Sure as crap,it,was a GriffonÂ  rotary vise and everything was in the bundle.Â  One motion jaw for all hook sizes .Reg $200 marked down to $19. I asked no questions. B-Line it to the cash,pay and yelling,start the Ram, start the Ram. LOL  Out with the old  In with the new
Is this a new job. 	Brianâ€™s fly and tie services
We can leave this open to interpretation...
Super score !!!! Â  that cave is always worth poking around.
Got a similar type deal on my Renzetti Traveller. Made a custom ice rod for a buddy and we traded.
Nice score Brian, I can't tie a fly to save my butt but I can see aÂ  work of art when they made that vise. Art

Sweet pick up! I wanted to buy my first fly vise. Â A few days agoÂ I had the Peak rotary vise in my Cabelas cart and it was on sale for $189 but I just checked now and itâ€™s back to retail at $229 ğŸ‘ I wonder how that Griffin viseÂ dropped to $19?
Super deal Brian! Heres my$24 Bass pro special .Made in india .A few tweeks and it works!! Lol! A few of my latest ties! Git atter! The fish are waitin!!! Cheers and happy tying!

Your old vise was my step up from Canadian Tire kit vise I started with. $60 from Sail I was ripping it. Couple years I'm thinking stepping up looking at $200-Â  300 vises. Then a Ganny legend OMJ was sellingÂ  fly stuff and part of that was a Renzetti ,what a step up. Just this last year I got the old out and tried using it Mmmm sold it.
